intro: Costus spiralis var. hirsutus, commonly known as the hairy spiral costus, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa and Asia. It belongs to the Zingiberaceae family, which includes gingers and other ornamental plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, upright stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its inflorescence consists of a spiral arrangement of small, white to pale yellow flowers, which are clustered in a loose, cylindrical spike. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is adapted to grow in well-drained soil and full sun.
